trans-unit.source: PeachPy – x86-64 assembler embedded in Python that targets High-Performance Computing use-cases.
trans-unit.target: PeachPy – x86-64 assembler embedded in Python that targets High-Performance Computing use-cases.

trans-unit.source: Template-Assembly – Embedding x86 assembly code in C++ with metaprogramming using a domain specific language.
trans-unit.target: Template-Assembly – Embedding x86 assembly code in C++ with metaprogramming using a domain specific language.

trans-unit.source: A Python module that reads the XML file and represents it as a set of Python objects
trans-unit.target: A Python module that reads the XML file and represents it as a set of Python objects

trans-unit.source: Summary description
trans-unit.target: Summary description

trans-unit.source: The goal of this project is to document instruction sets in a format convenient for tools development. An instruction set is represented by three files:
trans-unit.target: The goal of this project is to document instruction sets in a format convenient for tools development. An instruction set is represented by three files:

trans-unit.source: The project provides descriptions for most user-mode x86, x86-64, and k1om instructions up to AVX-512 and SHA (including 3dnow!+, XOP, FMA3, FMA4, TBM and BMI2). The following instructions are currently NOT supported:
trans-unit.target: The project provides descriptions for most user-mode x86, x86-64, and k1om instructions up to AVX-512 and SHA (including 3dnow!+, XOP, FMA3, FMA4, TBM and BMI2). The following instructions are currently NOT supported:

trans-unit.source: The work was supported in part by grants to Prof. Richard Vuduc’s research lab, The HPC Garage, from the National Science Foundation (NSF) under NSF CAREER award number 0953100; and a grant from the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) Computer Science Study Group program
trans-unit.target: The work was supported in part by grants to Prof. Richard Vuduc’s research lab, The HPC Garage, from the National Science Foundation (NSF) under NSF CAREER award number 0953100; and a grant from the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) Computer Science Study Group program

trans-unit.source: This project is a spin-off from PeachPy assembler.
trans-unit.target: This project is a spin-off from PeachPy assembler.

trans-unit.source: This work is a research project at the HPC Garage lab in the Georgia Institute of Technology, College of Computing, School of Computational Science and Engineering.
trans-unit.target: This work is a research project at the HPC Garage lab in the Georgia Institute of Technology, College of Computing, School of Computational Science and Engineering.
